content:
We just added (only enabled on chat.zulip.org and development environments) a new display setting, starred_message_counts, which lets you get unread-count style display of how many starred messages you have in the web UI, like this:
pasted image

The intent of this feature is to make Zulip better for folks who use starred messages to mean "things I should come back to later". I'd love it if a few people who use starred messages that way (or want to) tried this out, and commented on their experience. One detail that I'm particularly uncertain about is whether we want to display the starred message counts with different styling from normal unread counts; my feeling is currently yes.
We have to enable it ourselves, correct, @Tim Abbott?
@Steve Howell yep, it's a setting!

yeah, I think different styling for sure. Maybe just the number without the surrounding box?
Also I currently have 200 starred messages, which makes this not as useful as it could be :).
We could also consider the a lighter background color for the box, or something.
Another note is that I personally use starred messages for both "save for later" and "todo", so at least in my current usage it would never go down to 0.
Understood; I don't think this is going to solve your problem unless you change how you use it or remember a magic number.
https://chat.zulip.org/#settings/display-settings -> "Show counts for starred messages"
nice.... but why is it a setting?
@Grahame Grieve well, in part because it's experimental and we're not sure what the UI should be :slight_smile:

But also in part because I think depending on how we display it, this might be something that feels counterproductive to users who are only using starred messages as "things I want to be easy to find", and not at all for "todo list"
I'm very much in the 'todo list' camp. but if there's both uses... should there be a specific 'do something about this list'?
yeah, one idea I had was having either multiple colors of stars, or a different "todo" marker. But we haven't gotten too far in thinking about it.
